citation.article-title: Dactylosporangium darangshiense sp. nov., isolated from rock soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Dactylosporangium darangshiense sp. nov.

Dactylosporangium darangshiense (da.rang.shi.en′se. N.L. neut. adj. darangshiense pertaining to Darangshi, referring to Darangshi Oreum in Jeju, Republic of Korea, the site from which the type strain was isolated).
Aerobic, Gram-stain-positive and catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Vegetative mycelium is well-developed and orange–yellow in colour on ISP 2.
Globose bodies (1.0–1.1 μm in diameter) are formed directly from substrate mycelium.
Finger-shaped sporangia (0.6–0.9×1.7 μm) emerge directly from the vegetative mycelium and are arranged singly or in clusters.
Soluble pigments are not produced on any media tested.
Growth occurs at 30–37 °C (optimum 37 °C) and pH 6.1–8.1 (optimum pH 7.1).
Growth does not occur in the presence of 1 % NaCl.
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but casein, DNA, CM-cellulose, gelatin, starch and urea are not.
Hypoxanthine, dl-tyrosine and xanthine are not decomposed.
Nitrate reduction and H2S production are not observed.

d-Arabinose, l-arabinose, cellobiose, dextran, d-fructose, d-glucose, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, methyl α-d-mannoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, glycerol and d-mannitol are utilized as sole carbon sources, but d-galactose, methyl α-d-glucoside, l-ribose, l-sorbose, adonitol, dulcitol, meso-erythritol, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, acetate, benzoate, citrate, formate, malate, succinate and dl-tartrate are not.
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylinositol.
The predominant fatty acids are iso-C16 : 0, iso-C15 : 0 and anteiso-C17 : 0.
The type strain is DLS-44T (=KCTC 19560T =DSM 45260T), isolated from rock soil collected from the peak of Darangshi Oreum in Jeju, Republic of Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69.8 mol%.
